page.title: 05FARMING BALLINDALLOCH WAY
page.content: Most of the farming here is mixed farming.Because the land is hilly it is fine for sheep,and the farmers also rear beef cattle,pigs,poultry and in some cases goats.The crops grown are barley,oats,turnips,potatoes,rape,kale and grass for pasture,hay and silage. The greater part of the cultivated land produces food for beef cattle. Most of the farms are well mechanised so they employ far fewer workers nowadays than they once did. Major trends in farming in the area include the installation of a large piggery with over 2000 pigs at one farm , and ploughing up areas of rough land to grow crops at other farms. On the whole the farmers are a contented lot,apart from a few grumbles about the weather.
